channel.title: Java not recognised as a internal or external Command. HelP
channel.description: When i try to run my server it says java is not recognised as a internal or external command. please help me im really stuck and i want to open this server

item.title: Java not recognised as a internal or external Command. HelP
item.dc:creator: @Final-Rest Final-Rest
item.description:

Ok here it go i just downloaded JDK 5.0, But it say this…

item.title: Java not recognised as a internal or external Command. HelP
item.dc:creator: @i_lured_i i lured i
item.description:
@i_lured_i wrote:

[quote=“outrageouscape, post:3, topic:220014”]click here[/quote]Your an IDIOT!

Try redoing your “class” envioromental variable.
Open My Computer:

Local Disk (C:) < Program Files < Java < (The java you use. [Example:jdk1.6.0_10]) < Bin

Copy what ever is in your adress bar (Example: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin) is mine, Copy and paste that in your “class” in Enviromental Variables.

How do i get to Enviromental Variables?: Open my computer, click on “View System Information”, Click on the “advanced” tab, and at the very bottom should be a tab for changing Enviromental variables!
(THIS IS FOR WINDOWS, NOT SURE IF IT WORKS FOR VISTA ASWELL)

~I Lured I~

Read full topic
